summary: The document comprises records from the Assassination Records Review Board, focusing on the HSCA's staff payroll records. It details the partial postponement of information release, citing significant historical interest and no harm to the U.S. or individuals upon release. Specifics include payroll authorizations, notably for Elizabeth C. Feeley, a document clerk, and memoranda on payroll certifications and disclosures of employee relationships to Members of Congress.
key_findings: Partial postponement of the document was due to its significant historical interest and the absence of harm upon release.
Social Security numbers included in the document led to postponements to protect personal privacy.
Elizabeth C. Feeley was appointed as a document clerk for the Assassinations Committee with a specified salary.
The document details the payroll authorization and certification process, including the necessity to disclose any relationships to current Members of Congress.
